summary: Treva Manor is a player home based on Dragonsreach. It's very interactive and fully equipped for all your needs.
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://imgur.com/OO954GK.png[/img]
Treva Manor is a player home based on [color=#FFFF00]Dragonsreach[/color]. First I was creating it for myself but in the end decided to make it a bigger project and release it for public. The manor is still in Beta stage since I wanted to build and adjust it further with the community. From the outside the manor is stated on a cliff of the Treva river on the other side where Trevas Watch is. It has small stables, a garden and a few nice waterfalls. On the inside it has 3 floors with separated smithing and magic rooms, an inn (Yes, you heard it right. An inn!), assembly hall, a dining room, childrens room, some personal space and a balcony.



[center][size=5][color=#FF0000]Dialogue subtitles have to be enabled for this mod to work as intended![/color][/size]

[img]http://imgur.com/xQ4w8aD.png[/img]

[font=Century Gothic][SIZE=7][color=#548DD4][font=Trebuchet MS]NEWS[/font][/color][/SIZE][/font]

Finally released an update. Now the manor has adoption support and a third floor. Also requires Hearthfire DLC to work properly. As always comments, suggestions and screenshots are welcome.

[img]http://imgur.com/xQ4w8aD.png[/img]

[youtube]F958jgLmoP8[/youtube]

[img]http://imgur.com/xQ4w8aD.png[/img]

[font=Century Gothic][SIZE=7][color=#548DD4][font=Trebuchet MS]FEATURES[/font][/color][/SIZE][/font]
Stables with a free (Yes, FREE) horse!

A garden and waterfalls! Damn, those vegetables are even more delicious when homegrown!

Smithing room! With forge and all other smithing workbenches plus an ore basement where you can... well, mine some ore!

Arcane and alchemy room! Enchant a powerful weapon or create a magical potion or deadly poison to destroy your enemies. Take the ingredients from a small inside garden. You can even store your potions on potion racks and lay out your ingredients on the alchemy table!

Relax in the inn! Yes, an inn inside the manor! Drink some mead with the innkeeper and listen to the songs of the bard. You'll never forget the evenings spent in the Treva Manor inn!

Second floor with the assembly hall! Round table for all your convention needs, hunting trophies and a greatsword collection!

Your personal space! With a work table, rounded fireplace, bed and a custom bookshelf!

A dining room where all the family can eat together!

Balcony with a magnificent view of the river!

A secret room! Open to members of the thief guild. The room contains a fence who buys your stolen goods and can get you some artifacts from the story!

11 bookshelves, 14 mannequins, 19 weapon racks, 6 display cases, 3 potion and ingredient racks (if I remember how to count).

When you buy the manor from the innkeeper you can hire merchants to work in the manor and get you even more artifacts and stuff!

[img]http://imgur.com/xQ4w8aD.png[/img]

[font=Century Gothic][SIZE=7][color=#548DD4][font=Trebuchet MS]INSTALLATION[/font][/color][/SIZE][/font]

First of all since version 0.7.2 you need to have [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32550/?]General Displays[/url] installed for this mod to work.

The manor comes packaged into bsa. So you just need to dump everything in the data folder. It's as simple as that. And don't forget to turn on the subtitles!

[img]http://imgur.com/xQ4w8aD.png[/img]

[font=Century Gothic][SIZE=7][color=#548DD4][font=Trebuchet MS]BETA[/font][/color][/SIZE][/font]

Since the manor is in the beta stage I still have a lot of things to do.Like:

Add more artifacts and stuff that you can get from npcs since there are only... let me check... two of them.

Add more story to the place.

Make the getting of the artifacts not just buy/look at them process but some kind of a questline.

A sercret passage from the manor to the river, maybe?

Lighting. You can never get this right. Since I made it on my stone age pc with Cinemascope ENB (Hurray Stacado!) I would like to see how it looks on other enb's.

Bugs! Bugs are bugs you can't live without them. Here's one now! [img]http://en.opensuse.org/images/thumb/f/fc/Icon-bug.png/48px-Icon-bug.png[/img]
But seriously I will try to fix every and all of them.

More interactivity! More things you can do on your own or change how you like the better!

I'd like to hear your opinion on what to change and add. Let's make this manor even more awesomer and cooler!


[img]http://imgur.com/xQ4w8aD.png[/img]


[font=Century Gothic][SIZE=7][color=#548DD4][font=Trebuchet MS]RECOMMENDED MODS[/font][/color][/SIZE][/font]


[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/8655/?]Static Mesh Improvement Mod[/url] for those awesome barrels and ropes (the chains also! Almost forgot the chains.).

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/10652/?]Vanilla Mannequin Script Fix[/url]. So your mannequins wouldn't think they're in the 70's disco.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37256/?]Superior Rock Textures[/url]. The only rock you will ever need.

Grab this ENB: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/15425/?]Cinemascope ENB[/url] if your PC is 1 million years old (you can try the museum too).


[img]http://imgur.com/xQ4w8aD.png[/img][/center]


[center][font=Century Gothic][SIZE=7][color=#548DD4][font=Trebuchet MS]CREDITS[/font][/color][/SIZE][/font][/center]


So much people to thank! Let's start with the resources!

eldiabs, for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/11618/?]Modders Resource-Weapon Racks-Bookshelves-Plaques-Mannequins[/url]. It saved me hours from creating those bookshelves.

Blary, for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/2250922/?tb=mods&pUp=1]all of his resources[/url]. He made something that Bethesda forgot to.

Ghaunadaur, for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26729/?]Modders Resource - Potion Racks[/url]. Cause his racks are the best!

Tamira and Stroti for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36969/?]Stroti Resource Pack[/url].Telescope is worth a thousand words.

Oaristys and Tony67 for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/16525/?]Modders Resource Pack[/url]. Those sets actually help to save a lot of time and look very nice.

Artisanix for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17423/?]Paintings and Frames[/url]. Epic paintings. Have a look yourself!

The Fuzzy Physics Institute for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/44434/?]The FPI Aquarium Kit[/url]. It's better than TV!

Tueffel for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32550/?]General Displays[/url]. Saved a lot of time and effort.

TMPhoenix for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29249/?]Hearthfire multiple adoptions[/url]. You can never have enough kids!

Hanaisse for [url=http://tesalliance.org/forums/index.php?/topic/5441-development-journal/#entry83041]Lattice texture[/url].

Here are some other people I should thank:

[url=http://www.youtube.com/user/DARKF0X127]Darkf0x127[/url] for his tutorials on Creation Kit. I couldn't have done it without you, man!

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/1828771/?]Stakado[/url] for the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/15425/?]Cinemascope ENB[/url].

Bethesda for Skyrim, ofcourse!

My family and friends for their awesome ideas and helping me out a little bit.

Myself for coming back to this project even if my brain cells were comitting suicide one by one :D.
author: Thinch

files.name: Treva Manor 071BETA
files.changelogHtml:
+Added an artifact to the blacksmith
+Added Azura's Star change service to the mage
+Added a gardener-worker to the outside
+Added 6 display cases on the 2nd floor
*Fixed navmesh
*Fixed globe texture not showing
*Fixed NPC behaviour
*Minor indoor decorative fixes
*Minor outdoor fixes

files.name: Treva Manor 072BETA
files.changelogHtml:
+Added interactivity to mounted heads
+Added General Displays
*Dragon Priest Mask displays
*Daedric and misc artifact display
*Divine Amulet display
*Changed lighting
*Redecorated the kitchen
*Minor indoor decorative fixes
*Minor bug fixes

files.name: Treva Manor 08BETA
files.changelogHtml:
Now the manor has Hearthfire dependency!

+Added spouse & children compatibility
*Multiple adoptions mod required
+Added bath tub to the outside
+Added paintings all over the manor
+Added third floor
*Dining room
*Children room
*Display room decorative changes
*Navmesh optimization & fixes
*Bug fixes
